text: Gragg House is a historic home located near Blowing Rock, Watauga County, North Carolina. It dates to the mid-19th century, and is a one-story, log dwelling. It has a saddle bag plan and features a central stone chimney. It has a two-room later addition which gives the house an "L"-shaped plan. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. ==References== Category:Log houses in the United States Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses in Watauga County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Watauga County, North Carolina Category:Log buildings and structures on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina
title: Gragg House
